Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: xxxBlondexxx
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location, 1 minute from Damrak and 5 minutes to Dam Square, 5 minutes to Red light (a must visit!!) and Coffee Shops and 5 minutes to the Train Station!! The only time we got a taxi was to go the Hard Rock cafe/ Wagamamas, which was about 10 minutes away. Only let down was the noise from people outside the popular 'Grasshopper', but we really didn't mind too much, plus when we were out there Man U were playing Ajax, so noise was to be expected!! We stayed in room 4, and it was a bit 'leaky', a hole in the ceiling which dripped water and when you turned the tap on the water came gushing out the pipe, we were given a bucket though!! Amsterdam has such a lovely atmosphere, it's hard to describe, little canals teamed with bars and pubs, it's great :) A perfect location for a perfect break way, we shall definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: Scotlandzoe
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, the rooms are spotless and have a modern style. The beds are made every day and clean towels are provided every day. The hotel is central to the red light district, coffee shops and the train station, so there is no need for a taxi. The hotel is noisey but you are in Amsterdam so its to be expected! The stairs are fun lol especially if you have had a drink or a smoke. However I would not reccommend this to any one who has problems with stairs especially steep stairs. The staff are friendly especially the owners, we were made to feel welcome, I would go back to this hotel again. Dont listen to negative reports!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lexa85
Reviews.Content: I always use trip advisor when looking for hotels and this one was much better than the reviews give it credit. I always tend to travel to cheaper hotels and this is one of the best I have been too. We went to Amsterdam for a few days and stayed at Frisco Inn two nights. The hotel is in a perfect location. Less than 20 meters from the Damrak street, and yet in a quiet location. The rooms where clean and very comfortable. We had a room on the front side of the hotel and the noise was minimal. TV worked and had english channels and the shower room was more than adequate and clean. I would defiantly recommend. We didn't have a breakfast there so can't judge but there is some very nice bakery's and cafe's round the corner. If you are going to stay in Amsterdam center and only looking to spend a small amount of money you shouldn't expect anything amazing but this out lived our expectations in all ways. The only thing I can warn anyone about is the stairs but that is a dutch thing and any where else in the area I have stayed has steep stairs too.

Reviews.Title: “For the traveler who wants to be in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: Kman773
Reviews.Content: This is my third time staying at the Frisco Inn in three years and have had a great time every year. You are a ten minute walk from the train station, 5 minute walk to china town, 5 minutes to red light district and just 2 blocks from the tram, It is a small hotel, 12 rooms I think. Its location is awesome if you have come here for fun. My room was nice and clean, with a view of the street ( can be a bit noisy during the day from church bells) the room was modern with TV, hair dryer and a very comfortable bed. There is no lift and the stairs are very very steep, but thats Amsterdam, The bar is located on the ground floor which also serves as the check-in. After staying here a few times, all the staff speak english and also seem to be well traveled and are very friendly at making conversation and help you get situated in the city. I also noticed that the hotel is now renting out a few bikes and a scooter also. A great place to stay in a great location. Note, they also have free Wifi

Reviews.Title: “AVOID”
Reviews.Author: Ciaran101
Reviews.Content: Reserved a twin room, on arrival, after paying they told us they did not have a twin and we would have to take a double, which was not what i reserved. the room was small with no TV (even though it is advertised as TV in room), however the cables were dangling off the walls in a very dangerous way. asked if we would like breakfast in the morning said yes (2 slices of toast, cheese and ham and some yoghurt and musil mix) then they charged us 15 euro for the pleasure! when i emailed after to complain i was told there was nothing they could do for me and didn't care what review I put up, so here I am. Avoid this place like the plague, you do not get what you reserve and you certainly do not get what you pay for. Their lack of customer care is terrible, it seems they are only interested in your money and not customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Ace staff”
Reviews.Author: Kate J
Reviews.Content: The accommodation is fairly basic but was ample for our needs. And nice soft sheets! It's not mega salubrious but the staff more than make up for the little things that may niggle - they are welcoming, extremely helpful and friendly as well as full of great advice about how to travel around A'dam and where to eat etc. The bar downstairs is testament to the ambience of the place because they have some regulars who are immensely fun and friendly. Pretty much tells you what you need to know :) We had a lovely stay there and went away knowing that we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, expensive small cozy room...”
Reviews.Author: Lou S
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is great, and fun place to visit, with a lot of tourist tours and activities. All the tours take off from the center of Amsterdam and if you go there for 3-4 days is convenient to book a hotel right there. Frisco inn is too close only 3-4 minutes walking distance from there. It has very steep and noisy stairs, small and clean rooms, very helpful staff, but expensive for what you get. We took it for granted the friendliness of the staff and the convenience of the location, but we did not expect such a small room for 80 euros /night.....,but what do you expect for a hotel near the action!! Lou & Albana, Michigan, USA

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a little overpriced, but to the point.”
Reviews.Author: redhotninja
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is a great, fun place to visit and if you are going for 1-2 days, then it is better to be centrally located than far from all the fun! Frisco Inn is very central, next to all the coffeeshops and the canal next to the train station. The Red Light District is 4 blocks away, crossing the canals and all the ferry rides are about a block away. I will agree with some of the reviewers that the hotel can get very noisy due to its location. We did, however, stay in a room with a window overlooking the main street, so it was kind of expected. The people at the front desk are very easy going (we missed the checkout by two hours and they did not charge us extra, despite the busy season) and they were very accomodating. They've got a great little bar and will sit and drink with you as well. August is one of Amsterdam's busiest seasons- so we paid 95 euros a night (did not include breakfast). And the price was good, considering some hotels were going for 300-400 euros a night. Word the wise- the stairs are very very steep (so if you've got a broken leg or have problems climbing up places, someone is going to have to literally carry you up because their elevators are non-existant). The place is very clean and the bed was pretty comfortable (which can be tricky to find in Europe at times).

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and over priced”
Reviews.Author: alionwales
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, and on booking got a fair price of 70 euros a night, which we were happy with, paying the bill on arrival, price had gone up to 100 euros a night. we were told taxes, but 30 euros a nght in taxes, should be mentioned when booking. great staff on reception, couldnt do enough to help. we had a front room, which was very very noisey all night long, rooms are clean, location excellent... Stairs very steep and no lifts.. Outside were a few tables, which seem to attract every cannabis smoker from amsterdam,so you can imagine the smell in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: shellhyde
Reviews.Content: We paid Â£325.00 for 3 night stay this included the city tax at 5%, firstly all the staff were fantastic very helpful and couldn't do enough to help with info and times etc they were great. The stairs are extremley steep in the hotel, we were in room 8 at the back, it was small but clean, but the down side was the smell it was dreadful the weather was bad so didn't have a problem with heat, our window was facing an apartment about 2-3 foot away and they opened the appartment window and played music the first night all night, the 2nd night it started at 4am and the 3rd night they played it all night again, it was dreadful and very very loud, I don't usually have a problem with noise but believe me it was so bad we had to complain but there was little they could do, so would advise requesting a room at the front or you need some ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “welcome to the hell”
Reviews.Author: alyona_zlbn
Reviews.Content: awfull. small romm, no soap, no window, no air condition. NO NOTHING!!! dont make mistakes as we did. it's weird. the only nice thing - is distance to Grosshoper and nice people on reception. but it's not enough to stay there more than 1 hour(

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in central location... bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Malfie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for a few dys away in Amsterdam in June 2011. We didn't eat breakfast there so can't comment on the food but what we LIKED about tghe hotel is as follows:- * It had a fab location and couldn't have been in a better spot - it was a few minutes walk from the train station (for getting to/fron the airport), a few minutes walk from Dam Square, right on the canal just metres from the canal cruiseboats ticket offices and right in the heart of the red light/bar/club/restaurant/coffeeshop district. * It was clean and comfortable and had a television in the room, a nice view with big windows that open out to a "balcony". * It had a bar downstairs in reception and a few little outdoor tables - perfect for ending the night with a nightcap before going to bed. * The sdtaff were friendly, English speaking and helpful. *One of the staff owned a dog who slept on the pavement outside the hotel in the mornings and it was a pleasure to see her each day as we came out of the hotel (we missed out three dogs while we were away so seeing this dog put a smile on our face each morning). Now for thing we didn't like about the hotel:- * The room we were given was very small. You had to climb over the bed to get to the television and window - this wasn't aproblem for us as we use hotels only to sleep and store out things and we spend most of the days/nights on holiday outside exploring, but I woukldn't recommend this hotel if you want something more from your room then just somewhere to get a kip as it was so small. * There was no air conditioning in the room. We went in late June and there was a heatwave in the city for the three days we were there. Having no air con in the tiny rom made it suffocatingly hot. Even of a night with the large windows wide open it was too hot and having air con would have made out stay at the hoptel more comfortable. * The noise - the hotel is located right next door to a cafe and across the street from a busy bar/club and very close to many other bars and clubs. When the window was shut the noise was not that loud (we could hear chatting and music etc but only quite low and not enough to be intrudive to sleep). However, as explained above, when we stayed at the hotel the city was in a heatwave and, because there was no air con in the room, sleeping with the window shut was simply impossible. We HAD to open the window to make some attempt to coool us down but when the window wass open the noise was very loud. It didn't bother me as I quiet like that kind of noise to fall asleep to (chatting/laughing, cars, music etc) but my husband found it difficult to drift off. * The price. We found this hotel on a hotel website and it was advertied at 200 Euros for three nights. This was a very good rate for a hotel so centrally located in the city and it is why we booked the hotel. However, when we checked in, we were told the price on check out would be 220 euros. When we asked what the extra 20 euros was for, the guy mumbled something about city tax and didn't elborate even when questioned. We grudfgingly accepted this but the worst was when we actually checked out and came to pay. A different member of staff was on the reception then and she said our total for the room was 235 euroes - yet a further 15 euros increase! So the price went from 200 euros to 220 eurosd andf finally up to 235 euros! Considering we didn't eat breakfast and we had no mini bar in the room we were not pleased that we had to shell out hidden costs - it felt a lot like we were being deliberately ripped off! Overall, I would say that if you want somewhere in a great location to all the attractions of Amsterdam and you aren't bothered about sleeojng in a small room, then this is a great hotel. But bear in mind that if you go during summer there isn't any air con and the window being open is noisy. Also, make sure you know what price you are paying before they try to con more money out of you.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: AnEnglandTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. Our flight arrived early and I really wish they would have let us check in a bit early. Said we couldn't check in until 2:00 p.m.....it was 10:00 a.m. They did let us keep our bags in the bar. Albeit, unsecured, I was ok with leaving them there. Yes, the stairs are steep. You get used to it after a couple of times up and down, but the first time is hilarious. The room was clean, bed was comfortable, and room was large enough to move around with the bags out, but honestly just a glorified hostel room. Wi-fi worked all days we were there! Bring good earplugs if your room is on the front of the hotel. It's really noisy with the two bars downstairs and people walking by. But I slept next to the open window, ear plugs in and had no trouble sleeping. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good. But overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: i_heart_vaykays
Reviews.Content: Yes, the stairs are steep. Get over it, people! It's 30 seconds of your day. Here's the real deal: my boyfriend and I had one of "big rooms" on the top floor. It was standard double room for a European boutique hotel. Nothing fancy. It wasn't the cleanest room I've ever seen. The towels and sheets were grayish. Not a single toiletry. Tiny tv. Free wireless only worked 1 out of our 3 day stay. There were 2 big windows, but no fan or AC. It was pretty warm in mid April, can't imagine it being very comfortable in the summer months. The room fills with that familiar Amsterdam scent with the windows open at night. The woman who manages the hotel and the rest of the staff are great. The location is great. The room is fine. But it was 89 Euro a night. For this price you'd expect just a bit more. With SO MANY hotels in Amsterdam, you'd think they could lower the price to beat the competition.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel; clean, modern, great location and very friendly owner!”
Reviews.Author: SatchyBee
Reviews.Content: Situated slap bang in the middle of Amsterdam, less than 30 seconds to a coffee shop :) and less than 5 minutes to Dam Square. Have absolutely no negatives to say about it apart from the ladders/stairs, but thats a given anywhere in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Location central. Owner friendly. Rooms small, but clean. Stairs very steep.”
Reviews.Author: Watzfrau
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in walking distance from the central station. The owner offered us a coffee for free for a good start in the day. The rooms are small, but clean. Attention: Steep stairs. Since it is very central, it might be loud at night. Ideal for young people.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahbear1116
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days at Frisco Inn, and the location couldn't have been better! The staff were great, and the beds were very comfortable! It's a hit or miss with the rooms though. For the same price, you can either get a top floor spacious room overlooking the street, or an oversized closet with a couple beds and no view. Unfortunately, we got the latter, but it was still comfortable. If you book this hotel, ask not to stay in room #14, or the one above it. Overall it was quiet, and we didn't hear anything from the other rooms until our next door neighbors got into a screaming fight. Pretty sure they heard that from the street though. One other thing is that reception made a mistake and gave someone our room key thinking it was available. Fortunately we were there and decent. They were apologetic and explained what happened with the computer system to cause the misunderstanding. Despite that, I will stay here again, but when I do I will be requesting room #18 or #20 and posting a note on the door that the room is occupied. :)

Reviews.Title: “It's a hostel, not an hotel”
Reviews.Author: barbixa
Reviews.Content: The Frisco inn only good point is the location. Very near of the central station and red light. But it is a very bad hotel, you would not get a good night sleep. You are aware of the other people in the other rooms even if they are very quiet. The rooms are so tiny that you need to juggle your lugged just to have enough space to walk in it. The stairs are also a nightmare, very steep!!! I strongly recommend another hotel that is in fact a hotel. Don't get carried away about the other comments and the picture of the ad is not nearly close to the reality.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on! Will deffo return”
Reviews.Author: kayls1902
Reviews.Content: Hotel is spot on. Couldn't ask for a better location. Next door but one to the grasshopper, right at the start of the red light, 2 minutes to dam square and 5 minutes from the station! Staff are brilliant, couldn't do enough for you. Can't remember the names of the 2 guys on the reception/bar but their english was perfect and u could sit and have a good conversation with them! There was a little bar area where u could sit and chill after u've been out all day with a pool table. Our room was great. No complaints here at all. We were on the top floor so yeah stairs were a challenge but that was the fun of it! We had a laugh getting up them each time! Could see the damrak from our window. Clean room, clean bathroom, comfy bed and a couch. Spot on. Maid came in every day. Don't really know what else to say other than we will deffo return here again and the guys at the bar/reception even said if we give them a call they can sort it out direct for them. Overall great staff, great location and great little hotel for all that u need!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Oddbod1206
Reviews.Content: I arrived early Monday and our room was ready which was great , the stairs are very steep much more so then any other hotel I have stayed in , in Amsterdam. The room nothing like the frisco inn shows it's was small which again most rooms are in Amsterdam we might aswell of not had any pillows they where that flat made it difficult to sleep secondly duvet was stained and dirty. Monday night around 11pm I was woken by my carrier bags of bits I'd brought crackling I awoke to find mice all over it. With that we packed everything up went downstairs and wad told by the manager he could only stuff the holes around the room with a table cloth or we find a new hotel, these were out options at 11 o'clock at night. We went to find a new hotel but couldn't find one for our entire stay so we had no option but to stay at the hotel. The next day we asked a female member of staff if they could sort out a discount or something she said they would sort something out. We came back later nothing was said, we were served breakfast by the female the next day again nothing was said een when we checked out so nothing was done. The only good thing about the hotel is it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and brilliant value for money”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdamlovers
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the frisco inn! Very close to train station walking distance to practically everywhere. Stairs are a bit steep but but bad at all as all Amsterdam buildings are like that. Staff were very friendly room was clean and was exactly what we needed. Had a brilliant stay and we are returning this month can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: handoid
Reviews.Content: Very close to the station and in a great location (near a lot of coffee shops and food outlets). Extremely courteous and generous staff, we were given beers on the house upon arrival and also travel sockets for the room. Upon departure we had a few hours before leaving and they also let us leave our luggage with them for the day whilst we went sight seeing. With regards to the rooms, you get what you pay for, there should be no problem smoking as the beds are very comfy, also if you're baked then it's the comfiest place in the world. Standard bathrooms, no complaints, TV and programming is excellent (and hilarious) lots of animal channels.

Reviews.Title: “Basic - your looked after”
Reviews.Author: lilsaber
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed myself when I stayed here. Our plane journey got cancelled due to the snow and we only had a budget so we chose not to stay at the fashion hotel and find a hotel in town for the extra night. We came across this hotel by accident and it is a little gem. It is within 5 minute walk from Centraal station and is right next to the red light disrict. It is basic - so please do not have high expectations. However it is clean, has sky channels and is cosy. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They checked us in, offered us a hot drink and were there to help. Best customer service I have experienced in a while. The only thing I would not recommend is the breakfast as I thought 5 euros for a couple slices of toast and cheese were a little expensive. As if you go for a walk there are many cafes that have excellent deals for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: yoniyoni
Reviews.Content: Beware! They are thieves .... they used my credit card even though I paid them in cash. Do not recommend you to book a place at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Traceler
Reviews.Content: The location was great, very close to the red light district and train station so you can walk everywhere which is needed in Amsterdam, and this is budget accommodation so the fact it was ensuite was a plus - however it is a box. No space to even stretch your arms if your standing and you have to climb over the bed to get to the window. The bathroom is also a box, no space for 2 people or to even wash your face comfortably without getting the floor wet. Also checkout is at 10 - non negotiable, they charge you every house you stay in the room and have someone knocking on the door to kick you out at 10! I'm fine with the paying extra if that's their policy but I don't think a 15 minute grace period at 10 in the morning will greatly hurt their profits! Still it's central, and for a night or 2 is ideal, and again, it's ensuite which is not easy to find in budget hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST spot in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: TravelsLisa
Reviews.Content: Loved Frisco Inn! The location, the bar, the rooms & the staff where awesome! We will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lfcmark
Reviews.Content: ive stayed in the frisco everytime i have been to amsterdam and couldnt be better in my opinion for the price you pay. i had family staying round the corner and it wasnt half as nice, the rooms are clean excellent location staff always helpful and polite cant wait to return. stayed in the deluxe room which was bigger with a couch in but it was on the top floor (steep stairs) but its the same everywhere. the free wi-fi is a bonus aswell and signal was perfect

Reviews.Title: “Its a non Stop Disco, bet you its the Frisco..bet you didnt know..whohoo”
Reviews.Author: WolvieBoy
Reviews.Content: Righty ho then, down to the nitty gritty. It aint that bad yar knar.... Sited, quite possibly to the closest Coffee Shop of Dreams, Baba's, then it was always gunna be a winner with me but it had a lot to beat the MajellenMoon (Sp?) opposite Conscious Dreams.... Staff were friendly and welcoming...had a laugh with them about being stung for 24 euros for accidently getting on the High Speed train instead of the "snail train" to The Dam and the conductor being far from helpful.... The room was non smoking but they asked us upfront if we were in the Dam for "da schmokey" and they were more than happy for us to bring back and toke in the room out of the window - be careful tho as there is a 100euro fine if that bad boy fire alarm goes off - try the batteries lol... Room was small but accomodating if ya get me - it had all you need. Bed (complete with bed bugs - only down side - a big down side but i have seen worse). TV, Shower, toilet....steep stairs....but thats half the fun dudes! Like i said, you get what you pay for. Its relatively cheap, they have a good bar, you are near the smoke, the food, the munchies, the touristy spots (you get discount cards for different attractions and foody places).....thumbs up and will go back again... This time armed with Bed Bug nukes....

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sueWolverhampton
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel for Amsterdam. We like to visit at least once a year. I picked this hotel due to its location. We booked a small double. Yes the room was small, however it was clean, which i think is the main thing with Amsterdam. Some of the hotels are horrible. Frisco stands out for location, very friendly and helpfull staff. We will be staying next time we visit for sure. I will also be recomending to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Had a brilliant time.”
Reviews.Author: ILiketoTravel035
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you are on a budget. Clean good location and friendly staff. I would go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most”
Reviews.Author: mobeverton
Reviews.Content: I travel to the Dam at least once a year and have been doing so for 6 or 7 years. Having stayed in various hotels this is probably the best all-rounder. Location is 5/5. Comfort is 4/5. And price is also 4/5. Dont let the stairs put you off, all the buildings are the same - its just the way they are built. The only buildings not designed in the manner are new builds. If you want a decent place to stay right in the middle of the action then look no further. I have stayed in cheaper but to be honest would never do it again - I have stayed in more expensive places and you never got what you paid for! When 'most' people go the Dam its to have a blow out and enjoy themselves - this hotel caters for those who need somewhere to get ready and somewhere to sleep! Rooms are clean, well equiped and staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Just arrived back home after spending the...”
Reviews.Author: Pnezthc
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back home after spending the bank holiday in Amsterdam with my girlfriend, for me the hotel was perfect, nice price, location and clean, rooms could have been cleaned more often is the only complaint my girlfriend has about this hotel apart from that everything was spot on and I think I will definately use this hotel again 9/10 =)

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and clean. Close to station & in red light district”
Reviews.Author: austngrl00
Reviews.Content: This place appeals to the young traveler who wants to be in the center of things and not pay much money. Amsterdam is usually booked months in advance so I was surprised to find this place with only 2 days notice for a room. It is right on the edge of the nightlife in the red light district. It is very close to the train station. The rooms are teeny tiny but clean with new-ish bathroom fixtures. It's better than a hostel, cheaper than the Ibiss, cleaner than The Corner Hotel..... Yes the floors are squeaky creaky but no one wakes up till 8.00 so you should be getting up around then too for the 10.00 check out time. You will hear the neighbors footsteps and the doors slamming and such. It's clean, it's inexpensive...Go for it.

Reviews.Title: “can't wait for our 3rd visit back to the frisco”
Reviews.Author: edinburghnicko
Reviews.Content: my husband and i love this hotel and keep coming back to it every year we visit amsterdam. i'm a clean freak and this hotel has been spotless on every visit, it's about a 5 min walk from central station, when you arrive you check in at the bar, the staff are very friendly and try to accommodate your every need. definatley in the mix of all amsterdam has to offer and we never had a problem with any noise at night, to be honest it is amsterdam and i feel the place comes alive at night. they serve lovely breakfast in the morning from full english to sausage or bacon and toast which we loved sitting eating at the tables outside the bar. we usually pay around 200euro for a 3 night stay which i think is very reasonable for a hotel in the heart of amsterdam. we are visiting again in october and are looking forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “a central place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: egyptian_sunshine
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends at the beginning of June. Small, friendly hotel with good clean rooms and friendly staff. The hotel is in an excellent location and an easy walk from Central station. We stayed in room 4, front of hotel with a good view of Damrak. The room and bathroom was clean and tidy with clean towels each day. The stairs are very steep but all part of the experience! Would recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Room 14, just great!”
Reviews.Author: Ruthebest
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel and found the staff to be very helpfull and will do what they can to help.( Ash cloud upsets) Hotel room very clean and bed's comfy, could do with fresh towels every day, but hey this hotel is in a great location, clean and tidy, with a great little bar attached to it, again nice staff. Great price for a great stay, Well done Frisco Inn, Keep up the good work. Special Thanks to Richard who kept us upto date with flight information and DJ for us in the bar!

Reviews.Title: “OVERBOOKING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Saulo_Leitee
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, it was crowded. Our reservation was not respected. They route us to an nnex building that was terrible. The room stanks cigarrete. The bathroom is very small and dirty. The hotel is very noisy because there is a bar inside the hotel. And there are many steps of stairs to stand up to with your baggage. If you want to run the risk of sleep in the street, stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Carlym182
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Frisco Inn and my first piece of advise is DO NOT GET A TAXI FROM THE AIRPORT!! The hotel is sooo central that you can just jump on the train which costs about 4.5 each and easily reach the hotel. We got a taxi and it cost us 40!!! This hotel is in such a good location!! Basic but clean and well decorated. Bed was comfy and there was a tv and safe. Ignore the coments about how steep the stairs are because this is true of the whole city!! Yes they are very steep though!! The staff behind the bar were very friendly and helpfull.The owner is English so she was very great with directions etc - The bar was under going a re-furb while we were there and looks to be very modern. I would stress that I wouldn't take kids here - Due to the stairs and it's lively location. It is ideal for anyone wanting to stay in the heart of Amsterdam on a budget. Would definetly return!

Reviews.Title: “What better place to be than in the heart of Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: unbias_review
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we have stayed at the Frisco, the first time was 2 years ago. Rooms are small, but very clean. They have TV & a safe, but a kettle would be nice too! The rooms are fairly quite, despite being right in the center of Amsterdam - you can walk to anywhere you want to go in Amsterdam from this hotel. Staff are very friendly and there was no problem checking in early, and there is maid service every day. The major difference, since our first visit was room price, at $153 per night it was almost double what we paid 2 years ago. We paid $14 for 2 pints of Guinness in the hotel bar! Having said that it is still a 'reasonable price' compared to other hotels in the area, Amsterdam has just got REALLY expensive! When you're out and about expect to pay: $3.50 for a coffee, $5 for a small slice of pizza, $20 - $ 50 for a sit down meal and at least $5 for a large beer!

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend...”
Reviews.Author: Moston_blue
Reviews.Content: OK - I'll be honest. We were two lads on a 3 day city break and this Hotel was perfect for what we wanted. Location wise, its absolutely perfect. 5 Mins walk from Central Station. 2 Mins from Dam Square and Red Light District and all major pubs and clubs. Was allowed to check in at 11am in the morning which was great. 5 Euro deposit for the room card but thats no problem - got it back at the end. The room was very basic (2 beds and a shower, TV and a wardrobe. In fact, pretty much all that was needed. Stairs were very steep, but if your careful, thats no problem. The Noise levels were, like others have said, pretty loud, but thats to be expected in any major city centre. With the window shut we could sleep fine. Didnt see much of the staff but they seemed plesant enough, providing us with an iron when asked, another room key when the original one failed to work on the Saturday, and the room was always tidy and clean after room service. All in all, a very nice and tidy hotel which I would definately recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the city, but just right!”
Reviews.Author: Kman773
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a ten minute walk form the train station. It is like two blocks from the red light district and a block form the tram. It is a GREAT location. It can be a bit loud from passer-bys and church bells. the stairs are very steep even by Amsterdam standards. The room was modern and clean, staff nice. If you want quiet and family look elsewhere. If you want fun or romance or just to be close to everything this is your spot!

Reviews.Title: “very noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: jolamo30
Reviews.Content: We were not impressed with this hotel and was over-priced for what we got. The walls were very thin and it was very noisy at night, we hardly slept! The location was very good. If you are looking for a central hotel and want to stay up all night then it would be okay but if you want a relaxing break then this isn't the one.

Reviews.Title: “What a Farce”
Reviews.Author: superfreak29
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the hotel all looked ok, the checkin turned out to be the bar, this went soothly enough, we made our way up to our rooms only to find that the double rooms we had booked turned out to be twin rooms, on opening the door we were met by 2 single beds pushed together leaving abot 9 inches at the end of the bed to get by. The toilet was one end of the room and the shower on the other end, on opening the blind on the window we find we are about 15feet away from the next hotel looking straight in to the room opposite. there was no soap shampoo etc in the shower room as you would normally find in a hotel, there was no breakfast because the kitchen was closed even though the web site says breakfasts. The staff were friendly and did try to help with problems in a fashion, The rooms needed decorating but were clean, the aircon unit for the hotel oposite made a noise all night so it was a good job i did not want to sleep much. Overall I was dissapointed with the hotel the photos on the web page look great (must have been a differrent hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Room”
Reviews.Author: spartan95
Reviews.Content: I visited Amsterdam for just 2.5 days and spent both nights at the Frisco. For the price it seemed like the nicest place when I was looking for a room online and was pleasantly surprised when I arrived and it met my expectations. The location is excellent and although close to the action not overly noisy. Note, the first floor is actually the second and so on. The pub downstairs is a great place to have a beverage and chat with the servers and locals. Everyone was friendly and happy to offer suggestions to me. The room was larger than I expected, clean and had a comfortable bed with clean linens. This is not a luxury hotel but is great for travellers on a budget that want something more than a hostel. The stairs are steep but when checking in and out gentlemen offered to carry my bag for me both times, once a fellow traveller and once one of the staff. I hope to return to Amsterdam and will stay at the Frisco again when I do. I booked directly with the staff online and had no trouble with my charges. There is no lobby - check in at the bar. The rooms are accessable only with a keycard, added to my feeling of security.

Reviews.Title: “Top Place, Top Staff, Top Location”
Reviews.Author: ukuva
Reviews.Content: Firstly IGNORE all the bad reviews about this place. This is an excellent little hotel in a top location in Amsterdam. The bad reviews say it is small, the steps are steep, the room have no air con etc etc..........and? What do you expect...The Marriott? The hotel is maybe 500 metres from Central Station, 50 metres from the Damrak, 100 metres from Dam Square and 50 metres from the Red Light area. It doesn't get much better than that folks. I have stayed here with friends twice and each time it has been excellent. Yes the steps are very steep, but where in Amsterdam are they not steep? There is no elevator, so beware if you are unable to walk up the steps. The room are spotless and the beds are comfy. There is a small tv in each room. The rooms at the front can be noisy if you have the windows are left open. The staff are extremely friendly and the owner is more than helpful. One or two of the rooms can get very warm, not much you can do about that, but there is a fan in some of the rooms. I would recommend this to lads and lasses going to 'dam if you can get it at a reasonable rate. The only thing spoiling Amsterdam at the moment is the beer prices...Dam Square 7 euro a pint, The Grasshopper 7 euro a pint, Teasers 6.50 euro a pint...the hotel is the cheapest we could find at 4.50 euro. Please contact me if you want any further info on this hotel or the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: mariedavies28
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. We have been to Amsterdam six times and this is by far the best location (for the money). The staff are extremely helpful, if you want anything just ask. I will mention the stairs because they are steep but they are in nearly all the Hotels in Amsterdam. The room we stayed in had a view of Damrak, which is a bonus - usually you look at a wall when you open the windows, even in the more expensive Hotels we have stayed in. Will definately go back to stay at the Frisco.

Reviews.Title: “It's a dump!!!”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustak
Reviews.Content: I should have checked out of this hotel as soon as I checked in and found other accommodations. However, due to the weariness of traveling, the late hour that I checked in, trying to get my bearings, getting over a cold, and figuring that all accommodations in Amsterdam were pretty much the same, I stayed. This hotel really soured my experience in Amsterdam, though. Again, my fault for not checking out and finding something else. I just stayed here for 5 nights in late Nov., the first few days of Dec. of this year, ('08.) Another poster said to call this a hostel, and advertize it as such, and I'm afraid they were right. It does not look like the picture on their website. Yes, the stairs are exactly like TA's pictures & like everybody else said. I'm up for adventure, & I realize that most everywhere in Amsterdam has stairs probably similar to this, but it felt like crawling up a ladder, to the point that I felt trapped several stories up & dreaded going down those stairs again. To be fair, the hotel is in a good location, just around the corner from the Red Light District. And around another corner and across the street to tour offices where you can meet their buses & take their tours. It is also a 5-7 minute walk to the main train station. Across from this station is where you catch the canal boat tours, as well. Also, it was not "youth hostel-like" in regards to a shared bathroom. It did have a TV in the corner of wall, near the ceiling; and it had a crisp down comforter/duvet, with down pillows; and they did come to clean, (although it did not feel very clean, except for the bathroom.) The room itself was tiny. Small does not bother me, as a huge part of traveling overseas for me is the charm of everything & the difference of things. But this hotel just rubbed me wrong in every way. Other hotels that I have stayed in, namely in Italy, had tiny rooms. However, they were clean, with amenities, & overall just very nice. This hotel just felt like a rip-off! I try not to take into account the Euro to the USD, but I paid the equivalent of 100 USD for this place that I felt was not worth it. After being fair about the good parts of this hotel, here goes the bad. There were no pictures on the walls of any sort, just a lot of scratches, & what appeared to be dirt or scrapes on the lower part of the walls. The walls themselves looked like someone needed to climb those "ladder stairs" with several cans of paint & put a few layers on the walls to spruce it up. Next, my booking said that there was a wake-up call available. This is usually not a big deal, but there were no amenities whatsoever at this hotel. No alarm clock. No telephone. And, I'm sure the girls at the bar were not going to climb 3 flights of stairs to wake up their guests. (My alarm clock stopped working & I had to search all over Amsterdam for a new one.) There was no end table, just a table in front of a mirror, with 2 stools pushed underneath it. I used one stool for an end table and wiped it with wet tissue paper, which came out black. Yuck! The other stool literally looked like it had a streak of dried vomit on it. Double yuck! There was also what looked like a streak of some kind of dried fluid, drink or some sort that dripped down the inside of the closet. The carpet was brown & just seemed dirty. Although I saw the girl with a vacumm, it just seemed like it needed to be ripped up & hardwood flooring put in. There was a safe in the closet as advertized, which I did not use. And a strange, almost industrial-like garbage can in the corner next to the door, which seemed dirty. It had a donut-type hole where you put your garbage in, which just seemed like it needed a good scrubbing. The shower got water out the door onto the brown carpet. So then it seemed like a dirty, wet carpet. A couple of days into my stay, I finally figured out how to arrange the shower curtain to be lower & hence try not to get the water out of the shower, as much. There were no drinking glasses, no tea/coffee, hot water kettle, no internet services. None of these things do I expect. However, I have stayed at places for a lot less that were wonderful, that you felt like you were on vacation and not "slumming it," and offered such abovementioned things, which just made the stay pleasant and pleasurable. Not at the Frisco Inn. Maybe if I would have paid someting like 35 Euro, it would have seemed tolerable and somewhat worth it. Also, maybe if they would have advertized truthfully, then I would have know what I was getting myself into? I figure that it is just possible that Amsterdam is expensive, like Switzerland, and does not offer value for your $. So be it. At least advertize as such, so that the consumer can make an educated decision. I don't know. I do know that this hotel really soured my experience there and made me really mad. From the get go, they charged my credit card the minute I arrived. Very strange. And not normal. I stayed at 6 other hotels in the timespan of this trip & every single one of them did not charge my card until the end. Only one put a hold on my card for the amount. Other normal hotels also have front desk clerks 24 hours. This hotel seemed like they were "double dipping" with the bar attendents hanging out having no concern for their guests. The day that I checked out & waited for my airport pick-up one of the bar gals asked if I would like something to drink. When I said yes, tea please, I was given a tea bag and hot water for 2 euro! I think the whole thing just made me mad. The bar was empty, with 3 bartenders, two on their off shift, making themselves different drinks, coffee, etc. & they couldn't even offer a guest something. (Again, other hotels that want to provide value & a service to their guests, lo and behold, have even offered breakfast with their rooms!) My feeling about Amsterdam is that most people just go there to party. At least in this section of the town. It seemed like why should the Frisco Inn provide any sort of service, if people staying there are just going to get drunk & high? It's just my opinion. On the bright side, I enjoyed the hop-on, hop-off canal cruises, the Anne Frank House, the Rjkmuseum, the Rembrant House, the Van Gogh museum, and a tour outside of the city. However, there's got to be better accommodations for the price. I would stay away from the Frisco Inn, unless you get a really good deal, and you are aware that it is just a bed & a private bath, & not much else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Cheeky79
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at this hotel. The location was fantastic and staff were very friendly. The room was basic but clean and fine for a long weekend. The stairs are steep but not half as bad as you expect after reading the reviews. The breakfast is really nice at the hotel, which you have to pay extra for. We were able to leave our cases in the hotel as our flight did not leave until the afternoon. Will definitely be returning here next year due to the location, cost and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BorderCityBoy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I capped off our European vacation this year with a couple of nights in Amsterdam to close out our trip. As we were flying in and out of Amsterdam, we wanted a hotel that was located close to the train station, and close to transit links. The Frisco Inn despite being located on the outer edge of the Red Light District was fantastic. Our room was on the top floor overlooking the street and was huge! By far one of the largest rooms I've ever stayed in anywhere in Europe. The room was spotlessly clean, and despite overlooking the street, and having a bar on the main floor, was much quieter than expected. The only drawback was the stairs. Being on the top floor, there were several flights to navigate, but it was not that big of a deal. Luckily we travel with backpacks, but if you were hauling a lot of luggage around, it might be difficult. However, most small Amsterdam hotels have the same situation. The bar was very convenient if you want to pop in for a quick drink or two (or more) and the hotel seems to be run mostly by Brits. So English is always the native tongue. They even serve an English Breakfast in the morning. Most of Amsterdam is easily walkable, and while we weren't there for the nightlife, it is within easy reach of the hotel. For the price of accomodations in Amsterdam, the Frisco offers great value for the money, and the location is perfect. Regardless of if you are there for the culture and architecture or if you are there for the nightlife, and "coffee shops", this hotel offers a great base for both.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: JoshNL
Reviews.Content: Very central.. Clean rooms, clean beds, nice staff.. Rooms are very small, but that's normal for Amsterdam...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Location.”
Reviews.Author: JoMo72
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Amsterdam, and we were really pleased with the FRISCO INN. I agree with all the other reviews that the rooms were very small and the stairs very steep, but this in no way affected our stay. The bedrooms and bathrooms were all clean and tidy - what more do you need? We had room 20, right at the top of the hotel - up 3 flights of stairs, but we had the added luxury of having a settee in the room too. Our friends stayed on the floor below us and their room was smaller but equally clean and tidy. Staff all really friendly and helpful, and nice little bar below the hotel too made a good meeting point/nightcap stop. The location is ideal - 5 min walk from Centraal Station and right at the start of the red light/china town area - which has all the livliest bars/coffee shops and tons of food places. Overall, for the price and location this hotel can not be beaten, I'd recommend it to anyone who is just looking for a base to explore from.

Reviews.Title: “good value -- but beware”
Reviews.Author: seancathy
Reviews.Content: dont expect too much and you will be pleased rooms are clean and tidy (but basic) our room was on the second floor at the front(big window and quite airy) but very very noisy at the front of the hotel our friend was on the second floor at the back with a small window but very stuffy ( but very qiuet) the stairs are very steep but managable if you fit and healthy ,can cause problem if drunk the staff were great really helpful and pleasant all of the time the breakfast is very good and sufficant for a days walking about if you want to be where it is at then stay here, but beware it is very very very very noisy until 2-3 in the morning then noisy from 8 o clock onwards but the location is spoton if you are going for what most people go to amsterdam for the cleaners arnt great but just ask the staff and they will get you what you want if you want cheap and cheerful go for it if you want queit and peacful this is not for you i would stay here again if the price was right

Reviews.Title: “Hotel? Morelike Hostel!”
Reviews.Author: Feckless_Wench
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I arrived at the hotel to be met with typical Amsterdam stairs...and we were on the 2nd floor. To get an idea of what these stairs are truly like, think Napoleonic ship and you'll have it! We never spend a lot of money on hotels as it's not the hotel room that we travel to see, it's the area...BUT...there are limits! The room we had was at the back of the hotel and small to say the least. There were an assortment of various lights both in the ceiling and the walls...one wall light was hanging off (rather dangerously with the switch smashed to reveal bare wires) and the other only worked if you banged the wall next to it (loose wiring). Opening the window we were almost floored by the intense smell of hash that came in....I KNOW that Amsterdam is a smokers haven but Sheesh, you should be able to get away from it in your own hotel room! Turned out that the A/C unit from the 'coffee shop' that backs on to the hotel (a whole 7 feet apart) vents right outside the window. So, good for a free high but not so good if you actually want to be able to remember your trip! The bed sheets were torn, the linen was decidedly greyish, the whole place gave an air of 'grubby'. Sound insulation between rooms was non existant and the wall had a huge crack running down it. 'Housekeeping' seemed to think it necessary to rouse the whole hotel at 8:30am each morning, regardless of whether you were checking out that day or not. Personally I go on holiday to be a lazy person and NOT get up at the normal time, especially after a late night. Not that there was much evidence of any actual 'housekeeping'....all that was done to our room in the 3 days that we were there was that 'housekeeping' opened the window....after we had purposely closed it to keep our posessions safe (see next paragraph). Smoking in the room was allowed as long as you opened the window. Well that's all very well but when you can almost touch the window of the building that is back to back with the hotel it's not so good. I don't want to be staring into other people's windows and I'm sure they don't want to be looking at me first thing in the morning! To me it was also a bit of a security risk to leave the window open when we were out of the room given that the buildings were so close. The 'safe' in the wardrobe lost it's code over and over...not that the code was much good anyway as you could clearly see the screwdriver hole for the code override. Would I go there again.....NO....90 euros a night is WAY too much for this type of accomodation, even in the city centre. Call it a hostel and advertise as such and it'd be more accurate. Would I go back to Amsterdam? YES YES YES....over and over again, I absolutely love the place.

Reviews.Title: “Frisky at the Frisco= Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Izzy08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Frisco Inn Early July 2008 with my friend- two girls, in the the beginning of our 20's and we loved our stay! Although very basic as all other reviews state but as best as it basically gets. Clean and newly renovated. A TV, two comfy beds, a mirror with a table, a closet and a safe. The staff is very friendly and helpful, especially when they helped us drag our luggage up those crazy steep stairs (which are the only downside). The hotel even gives you a lighter that says 'Stolen from the Frisco Inn' :c). The location is ideal as a central point to the highlights of the city and a 5 minute walk from the central station, the Red light District and the coffee shops (one min away from the infamous Grasshopper). It's not a hotel for a romantic vacation but is great for all other purposes. We'll gladly come back!

Reviews.Title: “Top stay for a group of lads/lasses”
Reviews.Author: BarmyWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th trip to Dam with the lads and the Frisco has been by far the cleanest hotel I have stayed in and even though the room I shared was basic (Like an oven at night - room 6), the bed was comfortable and the toilet and shower served their purpose! The stairs are a slight challenge, especially at the end of the night/early hours of the morning, but being from Yorkshire we were up for the climb! The bar staff were friendly and helpful and the bar itself was good with a pool table and decent drinks. Dam seems to have become very expensive with beer ranging from 5-6.5 euros and shorts even more and the prices at the Frisco were in line with most places and the breaky was ok, but like other places was 10 euro without a drink. In general the Frisco is a good place to stay if you are wanting a clean tidy basic room as a base for whatever else you want to do in Dam, we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “All you need (just watch the stairs)”
Reviews.Author: poutine_colleen
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I paid 80 Euros for a one night stay at The Frisco. As far as I can tell that's about what you'll pay for a room in Amsterdam. I don't think it was any more expensive than other small hotels in the area....some of which are not as clean, and are way sketchy. Our room was clean, small (by North American standards...but certainly big enough for the two of us) and simply (but nicely) decorated. The lady at the bar downstairs (where you check in...) was SO friendly and helpful. Since it was a Monday and check-in was delayed by an hour while all the rooms were cleaned, we were allowed to leave our bags at the bar while we explored for a bit. This was such a welcome change from London the day before, where no one would let us leave our bags anywhere and we had to lug them evvvverywhere. The location is great. A stone's throw from the train station...Dam square not far off, or the Red Light District. The Grasshopper is right there, one of the nicer coffee shops and my bf and I spent much of our visit there. The stairs are indeed very steep, but, we were prepared for them. They're not a big deal...just be careful if you'll be stumbling back from the coffee shops, and maybe leave the wheelie suitcase at home :) When we checked out Tuesday morning, we weren't due to catch our train out of Amsterdam until the evening and wanted to spend the day exploring the city. Once again, the friendly lady behind the bar let us leave our bags there all day. We were no longer guests, and it was very kind of her to extend that courtesy. I doubt many places would. That allowed us to spend the day in Amsterdam without having to lug our bags everywhere. I can't say enough about The Frisco, our experience was great.

Reviews.Title: “Sound for battered fish”
Reviews.Author: handleyr
Reviews.Content: Hotel Frisco 3 lads in their 20s in the dam for the sole purpose of getting battered (and we did) We arrived at the hotel a little before check in so dumped our bags in reception and told to come back any time after 1:30, which we did. We checked in (in the bar) and were given a room key each (â‚¬5 deposit for each key) and told where the rooms were and how to use the key cards in the doors. To get to the rooms, use the door to the right of the door into the bar. We were then met by the dreaded steps of Amsterdam. With bags/suitcases this is an absolute ball ache, you really have never seen stairs so steep. After the first time you go up them it doesnâ€™t seem so bad â€“ I suppose you mentally prepare your self for the climb. When we got to the room, it was better than I expected, although if you stay in a triple room, make sure your not the last up the stairs as you will get the mattress without a bed (not too much of a drama for us, the hotel was just somewhere to sleep for one night). The room its self was quite big, had a comfy sofa and coffee table â€“ basic really but sound for the amount of time we spent in the room. The shower wasnâ€™t the most powerful but it always had hot water when I used it. There seemed to be plenty of storage space for clothes etc. There is also a safe but we didnâ€™t bother with it. Smoking is permitted but itâ€™s a â‚¬50 fine if you set the smoke alarms off so smoking out the window was our plan. Check out was at 10:00 and breakfast isnâ€™t provided. All in all if going to the dam again for the same reason, this hotel is good due to location and closeness to coffee shops. The main problem with the hotel itself is the stairs. Another small problem is how far away the closest tram stop is, for some reason there is no tram stop between Central Station and the Dam on the Rokin tram line so theres always going to be a bit of a walk getting to the hotel. Apart from these minor glitches everything was sound!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: woolewis1
Reviews.Content: The Frisco is a very basic hotel, which is ok for stag/hen parties but I wouldn't reccommend it for anything else. The good points are the price and the location. The bad points are the many steep narrow steps, the tiny rooms and the unfriendly staff. Warning: The triple room is actually a double room with a mattress on the floor! The website definitely makes this place look better than it is, but it could have been worse.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, and Location”
Reviews.Author: carli85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Frisco Inn from Feb 29th-March 3rd. Check in was at the bar, and the people were very nice. They charge your card upon arrival, no big deal though. Reading reviews, I knew the location was great and for the price, you couldnt ask for more. The rooms were a little small, but very clean. Maid service daily. The workers at the Inn were very friendly and helpful. It was also a plus to have the bar downstairs. The hotel has 10 rooms total, and very narrow, steep stairs, just be careful walking down, I fell a couple of times. Overall the hotel was in a great location, clean, and a wonderful price. We walked all over Amsterdam, and I have never experienced a city like this before. It is great and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute job”
Reviews.Author: TheJob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with my girlfriend in August. Or was it September? :-) Lemme think... Anyway, the location is awesome... fly into Amsterdam Schipol... walk to the train and get in... get out at Central Station... walk a couple of hundred metres and you're there! Check in in the bar and leave your luggage in the hotel next door and back out on the street to gallavant and explore. The room itself was fine. Clean and functional. I read some other people's reviews who thought the place was grubby... dunno about that. I found it clean, if a little scuffed. But who cares? The bathroom was spotless. Some people seem to have had issues with the shower... did you maybe forget to pull the shower curtian shut? Just can't figure out what the problem could have been... I would defenitely recommend this hotel and would go back the next time I'm in The Dam.

Reviews.Title: “the frisco”
Reviews.Author: rossoredruth
Reviews.Content: really enjoyed my stay at Frisco inn , it is very close to the red light district ,shops and central station . will def go back again kelly who works there is very helpfull .

Reviews.Title: “No Thanks”
Reviews.Author: balmainboy
Reviews.Content: i dont think i would stay here again. We had no hot water for 24hrs during our 4 night stay. the rooms look nothing like the website .the room is the size of a shoebox(i have been to amsterdam 2 times so i know the standard room size) our room was dark all the time had to have the lights on even in daylight hours. our room backed onto the back of another hotel you could literally shake hands with someone in the hotel room behind us. the walls are paper thin you can hear people above you and beside you but in all honesty that didnt keep us awake ,neither did noise from the street or downstairs .it has the wet floor bathroom style set up with no division of the shower from bathroom. The location is its best point. located on the edge of the red light district everything is within walking distance ,central station,dam square,anne frank,coffee shops, all a short walk. the stairs up to your room are typical amsterdam stairs .steep (almost vertical) twisting with narrow floor boards it is quiet challenging getting suitacases up and down but thats amsterdam. the breakfast downstairs was quiet good and not to pricey.the thing i found strange was that you pay in full on arrival. i felt a bit worried as soon as they requested that !!! i would say to shop around a bit more, for the price i though it would of been a lot better than it was and im not a hard marker . just a realistic,honest one

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: squishySweden
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok value for the money - a bit pricey. I looked at many others and they are also not so cheap though. The room we got (standard double) was much smaller than expected and not as plush as the photos shownonetheless it was adequate for a short stay for couples and was of a reasonably clean standard. There were some marks on the sheets and pillow cases thoguh!! The bed was very comfy but the room too light. There was a skylight above the bed so the sun was shining directly in the morning. View from window was ugly (back of hotel) and was directly into someone elses room (only 4-5 metres away!!) The bathroom was clean, and the shower very spacious. Towels changed once during our 5 night stay. Haidryer available on request. The room had a cupboard and safe. The noise from neighbours was extremely loud you could hear without trying conversations and tvs!! Other guests insisted on slamming doors all night!! Bring GOOD ear protectors!! However we heard no noise from the bar downstairs (we were on 3rd floor) but then we were often out late into the night anyway. The staff were ok not exceptionally friendly or anything. There is no elevator and the stairs are almost vertical!!! Hazardous when carrying heavy luggage down them or arriving home drunk!!! Breakfast is served in the bar downstairs and is actually ok for the price and to get you started for the day. I believe they serve until midday or later. The location is bang in the centre 5 mins from Central station and 5 mins from the Red light district, however the street outside noise is very minimal surprisingly!! We would possibly stay again if a different and cheaper room and we were slightly desperate for a place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved The Frisco Inn!”
Reviews.Author: PinkHaylz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Frisco Inn in Amsterdam in April 2006 for 4 nights. It was actually my Dad who recommended the hotel to me, as he'd been to Amsterdam in November 2005 with all his mates for his 50th - he loved it, and so did I. I went with my boyfriend, so it goes to show the hotel suits people of all ages. He's going back there this year and we wouldn't hesitate to return either. BOOKING: We contacted the hotel directly to book, and they got back to us really quickly. They do need a card number to book (you don't have to pay til you get there, just confirmation), but they gave us the option of calling them if we'd like, if we didn't feel comfortable giving card details over e-mail. I e-mailed a few days before to re-confirm our stay, something which I do at every hotel, and all was well. LOCATION: We caught the train from Schiphol Airport to Centraal Station (much better & cheaper than getting a taxi), and from here it was just a 5 minute walk to the hotel and it was really easy to find. Walk from the station, straight up Damrak past all the tour boats in the dock, and on the first turning left you will see a property decorated in green (glows green if you arrive at night) called The Grasshopper, turn down here and you will see Frisco Inn facing you. It was so easy to find! CHECK-IN: You go to the bar underneath Frisco Inn to check-in and a really friendly guy will give you your swipe card, and explain to you how everything works, and then you pay him. It was really easy and all the staff speak fluent English, so no language barriers there. FIRST IMPRESSIONS: When we walked up to the Frisco, we were quite impressed - it seemed very clean from the outside even and the bar and staff were very nice. We noticed the hotel next door was boarded up (see photo), maybe some kind of renovation going on, but this did not affect us in any way during our holiday. Also this was April 2006, it might not even be boarded up anymore. THE HOTEL: You enter the actual hotel through another door next to the door for the bar (You don't go into the bar to get to the hotel) and you have to use your swipe card to get in, which is excellent for safety. We had to laugh when we saw the stairs (see photos) behind the front door - oh my, they're steep! It was a hoot trying to get our luggage up them, not so much if we'd had bigger suitcases I guess! They looked more like a ladder than some stairs. Unless the Hotel has put in a lift in it's new renovation, I can safely say this hotel is not for the less mobile! The rest of the stairs were better (see photos) but nonetheless scary, especially after a couple of drinks! We didn't mind though - it made the hotel more authentic... it would be a shame if they've taken them away during the renovation. The hotel itself was really nice, and really clean. THE ROOM: We were really suprised at the room - everything felt so fresh and clean. The bed was really comfortable and the sheets were crisp and clean, we had enough bedding and pillows. There were a few goodies in the room, like a free lighter and some leaflets for local attractions. There's a TV with a remote control that you can watch in bed, and lots of English channels to choose from i.e. we watched Eastenders once whilst getting ready to go out. There are blackout blinds in the room which are so effective, almost too effective! We got a front facing room with a really nice view over Damrak, however we didn't hear any outside noise throughout our stay. You are allowed to smoke in the room, this didn't make a difference to us as we don't smoke, as long as you open the windows. The room also has a hairdryer and a free electronic safe, which we found very useful during our stay. The room was neither hot or cold, but just the right temp. BATHROOM: The bathroom was soooo clean, and the shower was very roomy - not an ordinary shower cubicle but more like a mini-wet room with a shower installed. There was shampoo/showergel there if you wanted to use it, and we had plenty of towels. THE BAR: The bar was really nice and cosy, and had a lot of selection. You are allowed to smoke in the bar. The bar has a 'quiz' machine and a pool table, which we made good use out of when we came home in the evenings. I don't recall what time the bar closes, but we went to bed before it closed every night so it must have been quite late. They do offer breakfast and snacks here (not included in hotel price) but we didn't eat here. GETTING TO OTHER ATTRACTIONS FROM THE FRISCO INN: We practially walked everywhere to where we wanted to go, except when we caught the tram to Heinekenplein which is just a couple of minutes away from the hotel. It's within walking distance of the [--] Museum which is just on Damrak, Madame Tussads which is on Dam Square, the Canal Tour Boats on Damrak, Anne Frank Huis, Amsterdam Dungeons, and just around the corner from the infamous Red Light District. There are some great restaurants (an awesome Argentinian Steakhouse springs to mind) and a few Cafes in proximity. There is a great little bakery next to the Grasshopper that does an awesome 'pizza hotdog'! CHECKING-OUT: Checking out is at 10am and was really straightforward. We didn't think there would be anywhere to keep our luggage (but we didn't ask either) and so we decided to store it in the lockers at Centraal Station, not bad value but *remember* to have the correct change as the lockers won't accept notes, and remember to write the codes down. OVERALL: The Frisco Inn was a really great hotel at a great value, and we were amazed at how close we were from everything. We were practically on Damrak, and just around the corner from the Red Light District, and many famous cafes. It was really clean and the staff were really friendly. It was really handy having a bar beneath the hotel for a nightcap. ROOM: 5/5 VALUE: 5/5 LOCATION: 5/5 STAFF: 5/5 OVERALL: 5/5 (For the price, great hotel!) BAD POINTS: There was a smell of cannabis constantly in the hotel - the Hotel had annoying guests who kept smoking without opening the window in their room, which also kept setting off the smoke alarm. However this wasn't really the fault of the hotel and they did keep warning them to open their window when smoking. GOOD POINTS: Everything else! WOULD WE RETURN? A big fat yes!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Tricky steps”
Reviews.Author: RamdonUser123
Reviews.Content: Near to Central Station, Did not feel unsafe, Checkin was quick, Very narrow and steep steps. No Lift, Climbing steps with luggage was tricky, Fortunately we did not have too much luggage, Friedly staff Gave us a Free Power adapter for converting US plugs to Europe...was very handy through out trip. Reasonable for the cost 40,-euro per person per night

Reviews.Title: “Not good... Sorry”
Reviews.Author: gareth1125
Reviews.Content: Was due to satay here last November. Booked online, and sent confirmation (and got one back) sent credit card details and communicated several times prior to our arrival. Then when we got there we were told that they had cancelled our booking as they were going to renovate.... It seems they are renovating every other month at this place... Not impressed. We were left with no where to stop and they had made no other arrangements for us on our arrival. Be warned !!! Just cause you have a confirmation, it doesn't mean that you have a room when you get there. Shame really, as it is in a really nice location and is a genuine 3 minute walk from Central Station. But if the hotel management read this, please sort out your bookings!!! It's not good to arrive at 22:00 (as arranged) to find you have no where to stop on a busy Friday night.

Reviews.Title: “great place,its got everything”
Reviews.Author: rambo100
Reviews.Content: this hotel has it all, great bar (which you can smoke weed in) and does great food in the morning, big screen t.v. with sky sports, the rooms are small but very clean with en-suite bathrooms. Its also just round the corner from the red light district and a 5 min walk from dam square and mcdonalds (for when you get the munchies). All in all an ideal place to go with the lads and you could also take your girlfriend there. top marks for the frisco.

Reviews.Title: “have it!!”
Reviews.Author: jazzyjazzman
Reviews.Content: absoloutley love it. if your there to get caned its the ideal place and location. as for as cleanliness goes it is not bad at all, but it could be cleaner i.e the carpet could be nicer and the walls could do with another lick of paint. but to be honest as soon as the mushrooms kick in you wouldnt notice. Staff are brilliant really look after you breakfast is fantastic. i would recommend this place to anyone who wants a cost effective accomodation solution. Cant wait to get back out there!!

Reviews.Title: “spot on!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: perfect location, great bar open till late with decent pool table!! well worth it- ryt in the heart of the red light district

Reviews.Title: “Having it all in the City Centre”
Reviews.Author: EuropeCustomer
Reviews.Content: Great Price, Great Location, Great Pub! All in the heart of Amsterdam. Kelly & Steve are just two of the friendly and helpful bartenders who make sure you are comfortable during your stay. And most important, the Guinness is great! Why pay for an expensive room in the City Centre when you can stay at the Frisco and have more money for pints or whatever you fancy. The stairs are steep, but manageable, even with a pint of Guiness. The rooms are very basic, but have everything you need. For the money, this place is a real deal.

Reviews.Title: “spot on”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stay there every year and its simply spot on its clean and tidy ensuit rooms and the staff are very friendly n helpfull give it a whirl you can"t go wrong its bang in the centre...! we"ll definatly be back. tony.nick.nige.dave.craig.jock n trigger...!

Reviews.Title: “Nice one!”
Reviews.Author: cpaye
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here as our usual Amsterdam hotel was fully booked. The Frisco is a lovely clean hotel with super friendly and helpful staff. The cheap prices and central location (in red light district/ 5 mins walk from the train station) make it a sure fire winner. As stated in other reviews the stairs are ultrasteep and not for the faint hearted!! request a room on a lower floor if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: finkfloydman
Reviews.Content: We are a group of English Ajax supporters who come over quite regularly to watch the matches and we use the Frisco inn whenever possible. It's clean, friendly and right in the middle of the action being on the edge of the red light district and close to Dam square. It's also a stones throw from Centraal station. The Frisco inn offers great value for money, nice en-suite rooms, comfortable beds, a nice bar that offers good food,good beer and a happy atmosphere with friendly staff. What more could you want? I would recommend the hotel to groups of lads ( and lasses ) who want to stay for a short break. But I wouldn't recommend it to the elderly or infirm because of the very steep steps up to the rooms ( which is quite common in Amsterdam hotels ). A word of caution to first timers to Amsterdam.Watch out for lads who pounce on you as you come out of the station offering you cheap accommodation,We fell for this one once and was shown some right dumps. These guys work on tips, so when you add this to the cost of the room you are paying just as much if not more than the Frisco inn or similar. All-in-all great hotel,great location for the money and we will use it every time.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: simply amazing, only paid 30 euros a night and for this got an awesome room with mint facilities. also a great location. stayin in this hotel is a must. ive already booked my next stay for february.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal in Central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I came across this hotel in the budget section of the Lonely Planet guide to Amsterdam. This hotel is far from what you expect of a budget hotel. The rooms were clean and recently renovated. All rooms have private bath. The staff and the hotel bar were great. The best part of the hotel was the location. It is less than 5 mins. from Centraal Station, right off the Damrak, and walking distance to just about everything in Central Amsterdam. I would definitely stay here the next time I'm in Amsterdam. I got a great room for 70 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: (Excuse my english, I are not that good) My famly stayed here last month, we found it very pleasing, we booked trough their website -friscoinn.com-, very nice rooms they are very clean and friendly staff. Love the keycards insted of normal keys and the disapering pooltable. Good valu for money!!

Reviews.Title: “friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean ery friendly and loved the pringles they provided after one too many. the pool table was a bit dipped but many good games and a few arguments because of this but we were made to feel at home. next time i visit it will be for a bit longer .

Reviews.Title: “frisco not posh but friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ali and ram excellent, clean, shower,cheap, what more do you want. stayed in 2000 and 2002 hope to go back this year all the best christines cousinxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean and tidy, most rooms with en-suite shower facilities, bar and pool table, small but well worth it for the price.

HotelInfo.Name: Frisco Inn Bar Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Beursstraat 5, Amsterdam 1012 JT, The Netherlands
